com.github.mikephil.charting.components

Class MarkerView

  • java.lang.Object
    • RelativeLayout
      • com.github.mikephil.charting.components.MarkerView

  • public abstract class MarkerView
extends RelativeLayout
    View that can be displayed when selecting values in the chart. Extend this class to provide custom layouts for your markers.

      • refreshContent

        public abstract void refreshContent(Entry e,
                  Highlight highlight)
        This method enables a specified custom MarkerView to update it's content everytime the MarkerView is redrawn.
        Parameters:
        e - The Entry the MarkerView belongs to. This can also be any subclass of Entry, like BarEntry or CandleEntry, simply cast it at runtime.
        highlight - the highlight object contains information about the highlighted value such as it's dataset-index, the selected range or stack-index (only stacked bar entries).

      • getXOffset

        public abstract int getXOffset(float xpos)
        Use this to return the desired offset you wish the MarkerView to have on the x-axis. By returning -(getWidth() / 2) you will center the MarkerView horizontally.
        Parameters:
        xpos - the position on the x-axis in pixels where the marker is drawn
        Returns:

      • getYOffset

        public abstract int getYOffset(float ypos)
        Use this to return the desired position offset you wish the MarkerView to have on the y-axis. By returning -getHeight() you will cause the MarkerView to be above the selected value.
        Parameters:
        ypos - the position on the y-axis in pixels where the marker is drawn
        Returns:
